title: Amazon Prime Air Launches Drone Delivery in 50 US Cities
introText: Amazon has officially launched its Prime Air drone delivery service in 50 major US cities, promising 30-minute deliveries for eligible items. The rollout marks the largest commercial drone deployment in aviation history.

content.content: Amazon drones take flight across America

Amazon's Prime Air service is now operational in 50 metropolitan areas, including Phoenix, Dallas, Atlanta, and parts of Los Angeles. The MK30 drones can deliver packages under 5 pounds within 30 minutes of ordering.
The launch follows years of FAA negotiations and successful pilot programs in Texas and California. Amazon received unprecedented authorization for beyond-visual-line-of-sight operations.

The drones use advanced AI for obstacle avoidance, detecting and navigating around birds, power lines, and aircraft. Each drone is monitored remotely, with human operators able to intervene if needed.
Safety systems include redundant motors, parachute deployment, and automatic return-to-base protocols for any detected anomalies.
Prime members can select drone delivery for eligible items at checkout. The drone descends to backyard delivery zones, releases packages from 12 feet, and returns to fulfillment centers autonomously.

summary: Amazon Prime Air launches drone delivery in 50 US cities, offering 30-minute deliveries for eligible items.
